headline: Pelicans Guard Dejean-Jones Fatally Shot in Dallas
summary: The New Orleans rookie broke down an apartment door and was shot by a man who was living there.

headline: Mets Trade for Padres First Baseman James Loney
summary: With their usual first baseman Lucas Duda on the shelf with a back injury, the Mets traded for James Loney of the Padres, but is the addition an upgrade from New York’s other options?

headline: Williams Sisters Reach Second Week of French Open
summary: Serena and Venus Williams won their third-round singles matches, marking the first time since 2010 that both will be playing in the second week of the tournament.

headline: Eight Russian Athletes Test Positive for Doping in 2012 Olympics
summary: The Russian Olympic Committee said its was officially informed by the International Olympic Committee that eight samples from Russian athletes in three sports tested positive.

headline: Michigan Pushes Bills to Allow for Public Sales of Driverless Cars
summary: Michigan is preparing for the advent of self-driving cars by pushing legislation to allow for public sales and operation—a significant expansion beyond an existing state law that sanctions such vehicles for testing only.

headline: Migrant Killed by Truck in Calais
summary: An Afghan man was killed after being hit by a truck on a freeway near the French coastal town of Calais in an apparent attempt to sneak onto a vehicle bound for the U.K., officials said.

headline: Body Recovered After Crash of WWII-Era Plane in Hudson
summary: The body pulled from a World War-II era plane that crashed Friday evening in the Hudson River was identified Saturday as a 56-year-old pilot from Florida.

headline: U.N. Health Agency Rejects Call to Postpone Rio Olympics
summary: The World Health Organization says there is ‘no public health justification’ for postponing or canceling the Rio de Janeiro Olympics because of the Zika outbreak.

headline: Former Argentine Dictator Sentenced
summary: Argentina’s last dictator and 14 other former military officials were sentenced  for human-rights crimes, marking the first time a court has ruled that Operation Condor was a criminal conspiracy to forcibly disappear people across international borders.

headline: Fueling Oil’s Push to $50: Fear Is Back
summary: Oil-supply outages are at their highest level in more than a decade, even as spare capacity dwindles. That is bolstering the “fear premium” that has helped push crude prices to $50 a barrel.

headline: Small Plane Crashes in Hudson River
summary: A World War II-era airplane crashed Friday night into the Hudson River night about 2 miles south of the George Washington Bridge, authorities said.

headline: Pepper...and Salt
summary: Pepper...and Salt

headline: What’s News: World-Wide
summary: What’s News: World-Wide

headline: Cellphone-Cancer Link Found in Government Study
summary: A major U.S. government study on rats has found a link between cellphones and cancer, an explosive finding in the long-running debate about whether mobile phones cause health effects.

headline: What’s News: Business & Finance
summary: What’s News: Business & Finance

headline: Real Madrid Wins Champions League Title
summary: Spanish soccer club Real Madrid won its 11th Champions League title on Saturday in Milan, defeating crosstown rival Atlético Madrid on penalties after extra time ended drawn.

headline: Old Republican Bill Weld Faces Skeptics as a New Libertarian
summary: In his bid to become the vice presidential nominee of the Libertarian Party, former Massachusetts Gov. Bill Weld is facing a trial by fire in the quirky internal politics of his adopted party.

headline: Obama: Memory of Hiroshima Bombing ‘Must Never Fade’
summary: In the first visit to Hiroshima, Japan, by a sitting U.S. president, Barack Obama mourned the victims of the atomic bombing on Aug. 6, 1945.

headline: New U.S. Study Fans Cellphone Cancer Worries
summary: A new study found “low incidences” of two types of tumors in rats exposed to low-level radio waves emitted by cellphones, but many scientists said it was too soon to draw sweeping conclusions from the results.

headline: Behind Mitt Romney’s Increasingly Lonely Challenge to Donald Trump
summary: The 2012 GOP presidential nominee reflects on the waves he created by attacking the 2016 candidate and how he increasingly finds himself a voice in the wilderness.
